sections.Behind the scenes:
Marei first appeared in the Season 2 premiere, but wasn't formally introduced and given a name until the third episode of Season 3.

As of the end of Season 4, following the death of [[Ros]] in Season 3, Marei is the most commonly recurring and still living prostitute character in the series. By this point she has appeared in five episodes across three seasons starting with Season 2. None of the other minor prostitute characters introduced in Seasons 1 or 2 reappeared afterwards (save for Ros and Shae who are now dead), and the only other prostitutes introduced in Season 3 who returned in Season 4 were [[Kayla|Kayla the contortionist]] and [[Olyvar]], the male prostitute who worked as a spy for Littlefinger.

{{Quote|Now, as it happens, Marei... is quite the spear-handler herself. She's here to thank you for staying by my side as the battle raged all around me.|Tyrion Lannister to Podrick Payne|Walk of Punishment}}
'''Marei''' is a character in the [[Season 2|second]], [[Season 3|third]], [[Season 4|fourth]] and [[Season 5|fifth]] season.<ref>[https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1467367063512008&id=1429095274005854]</ref> She is a [[Prostitution|prostitute]] in the [[King's Landing]] brothel owned by [[Petyr Baelish|Petyr "Littlefinger" Baelish]].
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, there is a prostitute named Marei at Chataya's establishment. She is a fairly minor character, and apart from the name and the general fact that she is a prostitute in King's Landing, Marei in the TV series isn't particularly based on Marei from the books. Most of Marei's scenes so far in the TV series have no direct counterpart in the narrative of the novels. Nonetheless she is not, strictly speaking, a character entirely "invented" for the TV series the way Ros or Armeca were.

Marei in the books has green eyes, porcelain skin, and silvery hair, but is also very solemn. She is also literate. While in the TV series Bronn celebrated being knighted by having sex with [[Mirelle]], in the books he celebrated by having sex with Marei and another prostitute named Alayaya, simultaneously.

In the TV series, Tyrion pronounces her name "Muh-ray" (with a short A), as opposed to "Mare-ay" (that is, with a long A).
sections.Quotes: {{Quote|He's handsome.  You didn't tell me he was handsome.|Marei to Tyrion Lannister, regarding [[Podrick Payne]]|Walk of Punishment}}
